flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction:
If you look around on the internet, the large majority of marshmallow shooters are lung powered and pretty weak. This is a single shot pneumatic version that can be brought to max capacity with a minute or two on a bicycle pump. Fully pressurized, it fires marshmallows so fast that they curve from the aerodynamic forces on their uneven surfaces. Range is over 40 ft for roughly 30 shots, and it's more fun than should be allowed.

We'll teach you how, using cheap, basic materials.

This is a good weekend project, because it involves pretty basic cutting and gluing of PVC pipe and some other miscellaneous building. Nothing's too hard, and its something kids can definitely help out with while really reaping the enjoyment of using the thing. Not that it's recommended...
